Problem 1

It is claimed that the median weight mmm of certain loads of candy is 400004000040000 pounds.

  1. Use the following 131313 observations and the Wilcoxon signed rank statistic to test the null hypothesis H0 ⁣:m=40000H_0\colon m = 40000H0​:m=40000 against the one-sided alternative hypothesis H1 ⁣:m<40000H_1\colon m < 40000H1​:m<40000 at an approximate significance level of α=0.05\alpha = 0.05α=0.05.

    41195394853805040890392453103130906412293684038345349304078038050\begin{array}{rrrrrrr} 41195 & 39485 & 38050 & 40890 & 39245 & 31031 & 30906 \\ 41229 & 36840 & 38345 & 34930 & 40780 & 38050 & \end{array}4119541229​3948536840​3805038345​4089034930​3924540780​3103138050​30906​

  2. Use the sign test to test the same hypotheses.

Solution.

  1. Recall that the Wilcoxon signed rank statistic is

    W=∑i=1nsign⁡(xi−m)Rank⁡(∣xi−m∣)W = \sum_{i=1}^n \operatorname{sign}\p{x_i - m} \operatorname{Rank}\p{\abs{x_i - m}}W=i=1∑n​sign(xi​−m)Rank(∣xi​−m∣)

    and we use it with

    Z=Wn(n+1)(2n+1)/6≈N(0,1).Z = \frac{W}{\sqrt{n\p{n+1}\p{2n+1}/6}} \approx \mathcal{N}\p{0, 1}.Z=n(n+1)(2n+1)/6​W​≈N(0,1).

    For a one-sided test, we reject if z<−z0.05=−1.645z < -z_{0.05} = -1.645z<−z0.05​=−1.645. Computing the signs and ranks gives the following table:

    xi41195394853805040890392453103130906412293684038345349304078038050∣xi−m∣119551519508907558969909412293160165550707801950sign⁡(xi)Rank⁡(∣xi−m∣)5−1−84−2−12−136−10−7−113−9\begin{array}{r|rrrrrrrrrrrrr} x_i & 41195 & 39485 & 38050 & 40890 & 39245 & 31031 & 30906 & 41229 & 36840 & 38345 & 34930 & 40780 & 38050 \\ \abs{x_i - m} & 1195 & 515 & 1950 & 890 & 755 & 8969 & 9094 & 1229 & 3160 & 1655 & 5070 & 780 & 1950 \\ \operatorname{sign}\p{x_i} \operatorname{Rank}\p{\abs{x_i - m}} & 5 & -1 & -8 & 4 & -2 & -12 & -13 & 6 & -10 & -7 & -11 & 3 & -9 \end{array}xi​∣xi​−m∣sign(xi​)Rank(∣xi​−m∣)​4119511955​39485515−1​380501950−8​408908904​39245755−2​310318969−12​309069094−13​4122912296​368403160−10​383451655−7​349305070−11​407807803​380501950−9​

    Summing the last row, we get W=−55W = -55W=−55, so

    z=−55(13⋅14⋅27)/6=−1.9219z = \frac{-55}{\sqrt{\p{13 \cdot 14 \cdot 27} / 6}} = −1.9219z=(13⋅14⋅27)/6​−55​=−1.9219

    Thus, we reject H0H_0H0​ at α=0.05\alpha = 0.05α=0.05.

  2. The sign test statistic is given by

    Y=(# i’s such that Xi<m)∼Bin⁡(n,12).Y = \p{\#\ i \text{'s such that } X_i < m} \sim \operatorname{Bin}\p{n, \frac{1}{2}}.Y=(# i’s such that Xi​<m)∼Bin(n,21​).

    There are 999 of these, so our ppp-value is

    p-value=P(Y≥9)=∑k=913(13k)1213=0.1334,p\text{-value} = \P\p{Y \geq 9} = \sum_{k=9}^{13} \binom{13}{k} \frac{1}{2^{13}} = 0.1334,p-value=P(Y≥9)=k=9∑13​(k13​)2131​=0.1334,

    so we fail to reject H0H_0H0​ at α=0.05\alpha = 0.05α=0.05.

Python Code

x = np.array([41195, 39485, 38050, 40890, 39245, 31031, 30906, 41229, 36840, 38345, 34930, 40780, 38050])
m = 40000
sign = np.sign(x - m)
rank = np.argsort(np.argsort(np.abs(x - m))) + 1
print(f"w = {np.sum(sign * rank)}") # w = -55
print(f"y = {np.sum(sign < 0)}")    # y = 9

Problem 2

Let XXX equal the number of milliliters of a liquid in a bottle that has a label volume of 350 ml350~\mathrm{ml}350 ml. Assume that the distribution of XXX is N(μ,4)\mathcal{N}\p{\mu, 4}N(μ,4). To test the null hypothesis H0 ⁣:μ=355H_0\colon \mu = 355H0​:μ=355 against the alternative hypothesis H1 ⁣:μ<355H_1\colon \mu < 355H1​:μ<355, let the critical region be defined by C={x‾∣x‾≤354.05}C = \set{\mean{x} \mid \mean{x} \leq 354.05}C={x∣x≤354.05}, where x‾\mean{x}x is the sample mean of the contents of a random sample of n=12n = 12n=12 bottles.

  1. Find the power function K(μ)K\p{\mu}K(μ) for this test.

  2. What is the approximate significance level α\alphaα of the test?

  3. Use the following 121212 observations to state your conclusion from this test:

    350353354356353352354355357353354355\begin{array}{rrrr} 350 & 353 & 354 & 356 \\ 353 & 352 & 354 & 355 \\ 357 & 353 & 354 & 355 \end{array}350353357​353352353​354354354​356355355​
Solution.

  1. Recall that

    K(μ)=P(reject H0 | μ).K\p{\mu} = \P\p{\text{reject }H_0 \given \mu}.K(μ)=P(reject H0​∣μ).

    In this problem, we reject H0H_0H0​ if and only if X‾\mean{X}X lands in the critical region, so

    K(μ)=P(X‾≤354.05∣μ).K\p{\mu} = \P\p{\mean{X} \leq 354.05 \mid \mu}.K(μ)=P(X≤354.05∣μ).

    To calculate this probability, we need to carefully figure out the distribution of X‾\mean{X}X. Recall that

    Z=X‾−μσ/n=X‾−μ2/12∼N(0,1),Z = \frac{\mean{X} - \mu}{\sigma/\sqrt{n}} = \frac{\mean{X} - \mu}{2/\sqrt{12}} \sim \mathcal{N}\p{0, 1},Z=σ/n​X−μ​=2/12​X−μ​∼N(0,1),

    so

    X‾≤354.05  ⟺  X‾−μ2/12≤354.05−μ2/12.\begin{aligned} \mean{X} \leq 354.05 &\iff \frac{\mean{X} - \mu}{2/\sqrt{12}} \leq \frac{354.05 - \mu}{2/\sqrt{12}}. \end{aligned}X≤354.05​⟺2/12​X−μ​≤2/12​354.05−μ​.​

    We get

    K(μ)=P(X‾−μ2/12≤354.05−μ2/12 | μ)=P(N(0,1)≤354.05−μ2/12)=Φ(354.05−μ2/12),\begin{aligned} K\p{\mu} &= \P\p{\frac{\mean{X} - \mu}{2/\sqrt{12}} \leq \frac{354.05 - \mu}{2/\sqrt{12}} \given \mu} \\ &= \P\p{\mathcal{N}\p{0, 1} \leq \frac{354.05 - \mu}{2/\sqrt{12}}} \\ &= \boxed{\Phi\p{\frac{354.05 - \mu}{2/\sqrt{12}}}}, \end{aligned}K(μ)​=P(2/12​X−μ​≤2/12​354.05−μ​∣∣​μ)=P(N(0,1)≤2/12​354.05−μ​)=Φ(2/12​354.05−μ​)​,​

    where Φ\PhiΦ is the cdf of a standard normal random variable.

  2. We have

    α=P(reject H0 | H0)=K(355)=Φ(354.05−3552/12)=Φ(−1.6454)≈−z0.05,\begin{aligned} \alpha &= \P\p{\text{reject }H_0 \given H_0} \\ &= K\p{355} \\ &= \Phi\p{\frac{354.05 - 355}{2/\sqrt{12}}} \\ &= \Phi\p{−1.6454} \\ &\approx -z_{0.05}, \end{aligned}α​=P(reject H0​∣H0​)=K(355)=Φ(2/12​354.05−355​)=Φ(−1.6454)≈−z0.05​,​

    so the significance level is roughly α=0.05\alpha = 0.05α=0.05.

  3. Since the critical region is given to us, we do not use the ppp-value to make our conclusion. We just check to see if x‾∈C\mean{x} \in Cx∈C or not.

    x‾=353.8333≤354.05,\mean{x} = 353.8333 \leq 354.05,x=353.8333≤354.05,

    so we reject H0H_0H0​.

Problem 3

In a political campaign, one candidate has a poll taken at random from the voting population. The results of poll are that 311311311 out of 400400400 voters favor the candidate. Let ppp be the fraction of the voting population that favors the candidate.

  1. Test H0 ⁣:p=0.8H_0\colon p = 0.8H0​:p=0.8 against H1 ⁣:p<0.8H_1\colon p < 0.8H1​:p<0.8 at significance level α=0.05\alpha = 0.05α=0.05.
  2. Test H0 ⁣:p=0.8H_0\colon p = 0.8H0​:p=0.8 against H1 ⁣:p<0.8H_1\colon p < 0.8H1​:p<0.8 at significance level α=0.01\alpha = 0.01α=0.01.
  3. Compute the associated ppp-value.
  4. What is the smallest significance level α\alphaα for which we can reject H0 ⁣:p=0.8H_0\colon p = 0.8H0​:p=0.8 in favor of H1 ⁣:p<0.8H_1\colon p < 0.8H1​:p<0.8?
Solution.

Recall that for one proportion, we use the null hypothesis when computing the standard error:

Z=X‾−p0p0(1−p0)n∼N(0,1).Z = \frac{\mean{X} - p_0}{\sqrt{\frac{p_0 \p{1 - p_0}}{n}}} \sim \mathcal{N}\p{0, 1}.Z=np0​(1−p0​)​​X−p0​​∼N(0,1).

For our given data, we get

z=311400−0.80.8(1−0.8)400=−1.125.z = \frac{\frac{311}{400} - 0.8}{\sqrt{\frac{0.8 \p{1 - 0.8}}{400}}} = −1.125.z=4000.8(1−0.8)​​400311​−0.8​=−1.125.

  1. The critical region is z<−z0.05=−1.645z < -z_{0.05} = -1.645z<−z0.05​=−1.645, so we fail to reject H0H_0H0​.

  2. The critical region is smaller than in part 1, so we still fail to reject H0H_0H0​.

  3. The ppp-value is (taking the average of Φ(1.12)\Phi\p{1.12}Φ(1.12) and Φ(1.13)\Phi\p{1.13}Φ(1.13) from the zzz-table)

    p-value=P(Z≤−1.125)=1−P(Z≤1.125)=1−0.8697=0.1303.p\text{-value} = \P\p{Z \leq -1.125} = 1 - \P\p{Z \leq 1.125} = 1 - 0.8697 = \boxed{0.1303}.p-value=P(Z≤−1.125)=1−P(Z≤1.125)=1−0.8697=0.1303​.

  4. The smallest significance level for which we can reject H0H_0H0​ in this test is

    α=p-value=0.1303.\alpha = p\text{-value} = \boxed{0.1303}.α=p-value=0.1303​.
